_conversation._text: [b]Hello[/b], and [i]welcome[/i] to the [color=red]demonstration[/color] of my [u]dialogue tool[/u], press [font_size=30]left mouse button[/font_size] to skip the typewriting of this line and then once again to skip to the next one.
I'm here to tell you about all the different functionalities of this system, although there will be no visuals as that would take too long.
First step to using the tool, look at the top part of the editor and open the 'Dialogue Manager' option on the tool bar, and click 'Flowchart'.
Here in this flowchart, you can create different dialogue nodes by pressing the "+ Dialogue" button.
These nodes act as different sentences in the conversation, all of which having all the variables that are needed for a basic conversation.
First off is the 'Character Name', it can be changed to whatever easily, like in this sentence.
Then theres the 'Character Portrait', so long as the sprites location is in the resources folder, it can be used, like in this sentence (test image).
Then theres the 'Dialogue Text' box, thats where you put the actual sentence, like this one.
Then theres text speed, which determines how fast the typewriter effect is, with lower being faster.
And higher being slower
Then theres the 'Next Dialogue Box', which determines the order of how the flowchart is read during the deserialisation.
Then theres the small button with the 'x' on the top right, this deletes the current node.
Then theres the '+ Choice' button on the bottom of the node, this allows you to add branches that go to different nodes, like this;

_choices._text: Wow thats so cool! I am going to now proceed to completely yap as i want to test whether the buttons box will match the size lalalalala i hope it is please

_conversation._text: Thanks for agreeing.
Well I thought it was pretty cool...
Anyway, once your happy with your conversation, save it by pressing the 'Save' button, and choosing a file path.
Afterwards, take the newly generated json file, and put it on one of the NPC's in the example scene, like myself.
Finally, if you want to load a flowchart thats been serialised already, press the 'Load' button, and select the correct file, and it will recreated.
And thats all you need to know, look at the 'READ ME.txt' if you want to read a more comprehensive guide.
Try the system for yourself!!! :)
